content:
• Tuesday, September 4, 2012
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q2 beats across the board on a surge in total...

    More on Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q2 beats across the board on a surge in total revenue. Net income more than doubled on a 21% Y/Y jump in same-store sales. The clothing retailer also boosts FY12 guidance for a second time, now projecting an EPS of $0.96 to $0.98 per share on around $290M to $292M in revenue, and announces its CEO and founder, John De Meritt, has decided to retire. Current president Neill Davis will assume the role in January. Shares -4.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM
  • SRPT

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) files with the SEC an at-the-market equity offering sales...

    Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) files with the SEC an at-the-market equity offering sales agreement with Citadel Securities to sell, from time to time, up to $40M of its common stock. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • GWRE

    Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) guides on its FQ4 earnings call for FQ1 revenue of $59M-$62M and EPS of...

    Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) guides on its FQ4 earnings call for FQ1 revenue of $59M-$62M and EPS of $0.00-$0.02 vs. a consensus of $59.4M and  FY13 guidance is for revenue of $276M-$288M and EPS of $0.23-$0.30 vs. a consensus of $270.2M and $0.34. The Street is focusing on the healthy top-line guidance and strong FQ4 results, rather than the soft EPS guidance. GWRE +12.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • UPS

    UPS slumps in after hours trading on the back of Fedex's (NYSE:FDX) lower guidance. UPS -2%, FDX...

    UPS slumps in after hours trading on the back of Fedex's (NYSE:FDX) lower guidance. UPS -2%, FDX -4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 5 Comments
  • FDX

    FedEx (NYSE:FDX) slashes its FQ1 earnings forecast to $1.37-$1.43/share from an earlier estimate...

    FedEx (NYSE:FDX) slashes its FQ1 earnings forecast to $1.37-$1.43/share from an earlier estimate of $1.45-$1.60, and vs. Street consensus of $1.56. "Weakness in the global economy constrained revenue growth at FedEx Express more than expected in earlier guidance." Shares -4% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 25 Comments
  • PBY-OLD

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $525M (+0.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Pep Boys (NYSE:PBY-OLD): Q2 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $525M (+0.6% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) +1.9% AH after disclosing in an 8-K Mark Zuckerberg has no plans to sell...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) +1.9% AH after disclosing in an 8-K Mark Zuckerberg has no plans to sell any shares for at least 12 months. In addition, directors Mark Andreessen and Donald Graham have no plans to sell save for tax-payment purposes. All three will be eligible to sell following this fall's lockup expirations. Facebook also states it plans to report Q3 results on Oct. 23. (more on FB)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 16 Comments
  • TAC

    TransAlta (NYSE:TAC) -3.1% AH after agreeing to acquire the 125 MW dual-fuel Solomon power...

    TransAlta (NYSE:TAC) -3.1% AH after agreeing to acquire the 125 MW dual-fuel Solomon power station in western Australia from Fortescue Metals Group for $318M. TAC expects the acquisition to generate unlevered after-tax returns in the low double digits and pre-financing cash flows of ~$40M/year.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • MSPD

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) +4.1% AH on news it has signed an MOU with China Mobile (NYSE:CHL) ...

    Mindspeed (NASDAQ:MSPD) +4.1% AH on news it has signed an MOU with China Mobile (NYSE:CHL)  related to the development of "nanocells," a type of mobile infrastructure system that combines a small cell base station with a Wi-Fi access point. The initiative will leverage the 3G and 4G base station processors Mindspeed obtained through its recent acquisition of PicoChip. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • TGP

    Teekay LNG Partners (NYSE:TGP) -4.1% AH after announcing plans to offer 4.6M common units...

    Teekay LNG Partners (NYSE:TGP) -4.1% AH after announcing plans to offer 4.6M common units in a public offering; it expects to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 690K units. TGP intends to use the proceeds for general purposes, which may include funding potential future newbuilding deliveries or vessel acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $67.6M (+33% Y/Y)...

    Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ4 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $67.6M (+33% Y/Y) beats by $5M. Shares +12.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • ATGE

    DeVry (DV) says its board has approved an additional $100M stock buyback, which is scheduled to...

    DeVry (DV) says its board has approved an additional $100M stock buyback, which is scheduled to commence upon completion of its existing $100M program. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • MMM

    The DOJ is seeking to block 3M's (MMM -1%) $550M takeover of Avery Dennison’s (AVY -5.2%)...

    The DOJ is seeking to block 3M's (MMM -1%) $550M takeover of Avery Dennison’s (AVY -5.2%) office-products unit, threatening a lawsuit if it doesn't abandon the transaction. The agency is ready to move to block the merger as soon as the end of this week. As it stands, the deal - which was announced over eight months ago - would combine the two largest label makers in the world.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ1 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $220.5M (-8.1% Y/Y) misses...

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ1 EPS of $0.12 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $220.5M (-8.1% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • SCCO

    Southern Copper (SCCO -1.3%) postpones a planned bond sale after the Delaware Supreme Court...

    Southern Copper (SCCO -1.3%) postpones a planned bond sale after the Delaware Supreme Court upholds a $2B judgment against parent company Grupo Mexico. SCCO, the largest producer of the metal in Peru and Mexico, reportedly had planned to sell 10- and 30-year bonds as soon as this week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • AEGN

    Aegion (AEGN +1.5%) trades higher today after saying that its Hong Kong subsidiary received a...

    Aegion (AEGN +1.5%) trades higher today after saying that its Hong Kong subsidiary received a three-year, $13M contract from the Government of Hong Kong Water Supplies Department for the rehabilitation of potable steel water pipelines.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • PPP

    Primero Mining (PPP +7.8%) trades near a 52-week high after reporting contained gold in probable...

    Primero Mining (PPP +7.8%) trades near a 52-week high after reporting contained gold in probable mineral reserves for its San Dimas mine in Mexico of 584K oz., a 79K oz. increase from year-end 2011; contained silver in probable mineral reserves total 34.7M oz.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • WPX

    WPX Energy (WPX +2.8%) is upgraded to Outperform with a $23 target price at Howard Weil, based...

    WPX Energy (WPX +2.8%) is upgraded to Outperform with a $23 target price at Howard Weil, based on favorable implications from the QEP deal. Based on similar Bakken valuations, the firm says WPX is not getting credit for the remainder of its deep portfolio; combined with a strong balance sheet, WPX shares have "significant room" to move higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +15%) continue to rise ahead of its September 7 presentation at...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +15%) continue to rise ahead of its September 7 presentation at the 2012 Chicago Multidisciplinary Symposium in Thoracic Oncology, where the drug developer will present Phase II trial data for bavituximab, its drug candidate to treat non-small cell lung cancer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 2 Comments

  • Acadia Healthcare (ACHC +7.8%) trades up today after acquiring Timberline Knolls, a 122-bed...

    Acadia Healthcare (ACHC +7.8%) trades up today after acquiring Timberline Knolls, a 122-bed inpatient behavioral healthcare facility located near Chicago, Illinois for $90M in cash. The facility produced revenues of approximately $33M for the 12 months ended June 30, 2012, and is ACHC's first facility in Illinois.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • OGZPY

    Russia's Gazprom (OTCPK:OGZPY) says it has discussed supplying liquefied natural gas to...

    Russia's Gazprom (OTCPK:OGZPY) says it has discussed supplying liquefied natural gas to Argentina's YPF (YPF -5.3%) and the development of the South American country's shale energy resources. YPF hopes to lure deep-pocketed partners to invest at the Vaca Muerta shale site, which could hold enough energy resources to double Argentina's oil and natural gas output within a decade.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • OPTT

    Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +10.6%) rises after inking a new R&D agreement with the U.S....

    Ocean Power Technologies (OPTT +10.6%) rises after inking a new R&D agreement with the U.S. Department of Homeland Security Science & Technology Directorate to perform a new round of in-ocean tests on its Autonomous PowerBuoy, in an effort demonstrate its value for ocean surveillance and maritime security.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • MLNX

    EZchip (EZCH +3%) moves higher after Deutsche starts coverage with a Buy and $42 PT. The firm...

    EZchip (EZCH +3%) moves higher after Deutsche starts coverage with a Buy and $42 PT. The firm declares EZchip "the undisputed leader" in the market for network processors used in carrier Ethernet switches/routers, and predicts its edge router processor share will grow to 50%-60% in 2013-2015 from a current 10%-15%. Deutsche also looks EZchip's high margins and solid visibility. EZchip dived in early August due to the soft guidance accompanying its Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE -3%) will set aside an additional 1.1B Brazilian reais (~$542M) to cover potential...

    Vale (VALE -3%) will set aside an additional 1.1B Brazilian reais (~$542M) to cover potential losses related to a tax and royalty dispute with the government, determining it likely will lose an attempt to deduct the cost of transportation from the value used to determine royalty payments on minerals. Vale had previously set aside 314M reais for the dispute.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +6.1%) has turned into one of the day's top tech performers, in spite of having no...

    Yelp (YELP +6.1%) has turned into one of the day's top tech performers, in spite of having no major news to rally on. There could be more short-covering going on following last week's huge post-lockup-expiration rally.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • MDVN

    Medivation (MDVN +4.3%) continues to move higher today on the back of Friday's early approval of...

    Medivation (MDVN +4.3%) continues to move higher today on the back of Friday's early approval of its prostate cancer drug Xtandi by the FDA. Wedbush says that ultimately Xtandi will surpass Zytiga in sales and the pre-chemotherapy data for the drug is going to make it the market leader.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • MNK

    Leerink Swann weighs in on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +9.6%) after Medicaid's bump-up in...

    Leerink Swann weighs in on Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +9.6%) after Medicaid's bump-up in reimbursement rates, upping its revenue projection on the company to $675M from $626M and its EPS estimates from $3.67 to $4.21.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNCR

    Synchronoss (SNCR -3.1%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral from Goldman, which sees limited...

    Synchronoss (SNCR -3.1%) slides on a downgrade to Neutral from Goldman, which sees limited upside for shares until orders from Verizon Wireless pick up sometime in 2013. Synchronoss, whose software is used to activate and provision smartphones, has seen its shares dinged by slowing U.S. smartphone sales, particularly at top customer AT&T.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • PKT

    Procera (PKT +3.6%) jumps after announcing an unnamed "large U.S-based ILEC" (likely AT&T or...

    Procera (PKT +3.6%) jumps after announcing an unnamed "large U.S-based ILEC" (likely AT&T or Verizon) has placed an initial order for its PL8920s traffic analysis system, with plans to deploy the gear across much of its broadband network. Procera has been a standout performer in the telecom equipment space over the last 12 months, thanks to strong demand for its deep packet inspection hardware.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • NAV

    Navistar (NAV -6.2%) hits a multi-year low as the shine off of the firm's favorable EPA ruling...

    Navistar (NAV -6.2%) hits a multi-year low as the shine off of the firm's favorable EPA ruling seems to have dimmed to leave unresolved questions in place. For starters, an EPA plan to charge manufacturers a penalty for non-compliance engines still needs to survive court challenges to become a reality.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK +3.6%) rallies as more details leak for its high-end Lumia 920 Windows Phone...

    Nokia (NOK +3.6%) rallies as more details leak for its high-end Lumia 920 Windows Phone (previous), set to be announced tomorrow. The 920 will reportedly feature wireless charging support and a Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) Snapdragon processor. It'll officially be labeled as a PureView phone, but will only have an 8MP sensor (the Symbian-based 808 has a 41MP sensor). The details come as Digitimes reports LCD panel shipments for Nokia and Motorola Mobility phones have been declining in seasonally strong Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 11 Comments
  • ZLC

    Shares of Zale (ZLC +0.8%) ride higher again, as the one week 48% post-earnings rally shows no...

    Shares of Zale (ZLC +0.8%) ride higher again, as the one week 48% post-earnings rally shows no signs of reversing. The jewelry store operator has hit its stride as of late with same-store sales growing in double digits while it reigns in expenses and debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB +6.6%) makes new 52-week highs on an upgrade to Strong Buy from Raymond...

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB +6.6%) makes new 52-week highs on an upgrade to Strong Buy from Raymond James. The telco has been rallying on hopes its CyrusOne (NASDAQ:CONE) data center subsidiary will deliver a strong IPO. CyrusOne filed for a $300M offering in early August.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton (HAL -3.7%) shares sink after CFO Mark McCollum warns a drop in activity in its...

    Halliburton (HAL -3.7%) shares sink after CFO Mark McCollum warns a drop in activity in its North American home market means Q3 revenue will decline, and lower pricing will knock as much as three percentage points off Q3 profit margins. Analyst consensus had expected a ~2% rise in Q/Q revenues. Also: SLB -2.1%, BHI -3.5%, CJES -3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -10%) slips after hitting an earlier 52-week high as the company...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC -10%) slips after hitting an earlier 52-week high as the company announces the appointment of former managing director and head of West Coast Biotechnology for Oppenheimer, Matthew J. Plunkett, Ph.D., as it's executive vice president of Corporate Development. Dr. Plunkett has been tasked to lead the company's partnering strategy including development collaborations, licensing agreements, and strategic alliances.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • VLO

    Valero Energy (VLO -1.7%) moves closer to permanently shutting its Aruba refinery, saying it...

    Valero Energy (VLO -1.7%) moves closer to permanently shutting its Aruba refinery, saying it would convert the shuttered refinery to a refined products terminal as it continues to seek a buyer for the 235K bbl/day refinery. The facility's dependency on more expensive fuel oil to power it instead of cheaper natural gas places it at a disadvantage vs. other East Coast refineries recently sold.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • OWW

    Orbitz Worldwide (OWW -9.1%) falls hard on heavy volume as the ramifications from an antitrust...

    Orbitz Worldwide (OWW -9.1%) falls hard on heavy volume as the ramifications from an antitrust lawsuit filed by AMR starts to weigh more heavily on investors who are already antsy about increased competition in the space from the likes of Google and other major players. Shares of OWW now trade at their low for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • VQ

    Venoco (VQ +2.6%) extends for the third time the deadline for CEO Timothy Marquez to secure...

    Venoco (VQ +2.6%) extends for the third time the deadline for CEO Timothy Marquez to secure funding to take the company private. "Marquez has delivered evidence of commitments covering all of the required financing for the merger," VQ's board says. The deadline, which was to expire on Aug. 31, is extended to Sept. 13.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • UNG

    Natural gas (UNG +2.7%) prices may only have another month or so before more favorable demand...

    Natural gas (UNG +2.7%) prices may only have another month or so before more favorable demand dynamics begin to kick in, Morgan Stanley says. Coal-to-gas substitution this summer due to low gas prices helped keep prices down at a time when the gas glut was already pushing that way, but the firm says it’s getting closer to the time of year when those dynamics weaken.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +3%) trades higher on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan's Paul Coster. Coster...

    TiVo (TIVO +3%) trades higher on an upgrade to Overweight from JPMorgan's Paul Coster. Coster points out TiVo is adding new pay-TV customers such as Scandanavia's Com Hem, and forecasts additional subscriber growth with existing clients such as Charter, Comcast, and Spain's ONO. He also thinks TiVo could obtain a settlement for its patent suit against Verizon in excess of $200M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • RHHBY

    Unexpectedly weak U.S. manufacturing activity helps to drag European bourses lower in afternoon...

    Unexpectedly weak U.S. manufacturing activity helps to drag European bourses lower in afternoon trading, with drug makers leading the way: Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -0.8%), Novo Nordisk (NVO -0.5%) and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK -1.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH -8.2%) dives in response to CEO Warren East's cautious remarks about 2H demand, and a...

    ARM (ARMH -8.2%) dives in response to CEO Warren East's cautious remarks about 2H demand, and a downgrade to Sell from Deutsche. The firm is worried about the impact of declining smartphone baseband and app processor prices (it thinks declining Android phone prices will drive chip prices lower), as well as Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) growing presence in the smartphone and tablet CPU markets. Nonetheless, Deutsche sees ARM processors going into 30% of 2020 notebooks and servers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 2 Comments
  • CNX

    Consol Energy (CNX -4.6%) says it will temporarily shut its Buchanan Mine in Virginia, one of...

    Consol Energy (CNX -4.6%) says it will temporarily shut its Buchanan Mine in Virginia, one of the company's largest mines, because of global weakness in demand for steel-making coal that has sent prices tumbling. Buchanan produces ~5M tons of met coal per year, nearly 10% of CNX's total coal production.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • KSWS

    Shares of K-Swiss (KSWS +6.5%) trade higher with chatter that a takeover could be in the works...

    Shares of K-Swiss (KSWS +6.5%) trade higher with chatter that a takeover could be in the works floating around.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MNKD

    A couple offerings in the healthcare space are adding to the day's weakness: Biopharmaceutical...

    A couple offerings in the healthcare space are adding to the day's weakness: Biopharmaceutical firm MannKind (MNKD -9%) files an offering of up to $500M of mixed securities, while specialty pharmaceutical and medical-device maker Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH -5.6%) says it plans to offer up to $100M in common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM
  • DWDP

    Dow Chemical (DOW -1.7%) says it will rework its business structure and appoint business...

    Dow Chemical (DOW -1.7%) says it will rework its business structure and appoint business presidents who will report directly to an executive committee. The move is an attempt to boost sales by cutting bureaucracy and responding more quickly to customer requests after worldwide demand for chlorine, plastics and electronic parts plunged in Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • SWKS

    Skyworks (SWKS -4.4%), which closed near its 52-week high on Friday, is slumping on a downgrade...

    Skyworks (SWKS -4.4%), which closed near its 52-week high on Friday, is slumping on a downgrade to Equal Weight from Barclays' Blayne Curtis. Curtis argues the impact of Skyworks' expected design wins for the next-gen iPhone are priced in, and that Cirrus Logic (CRUS -1.3%) represents a better iPhone component play.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • TEF

    Debt-laden Telefonica (TEF +4.9%) and Telecom Italia (TI +4.2%) are rallying on hopes the ECB...

    Debt-laden Telefonica (TEF +4.9%) and Telecom Italia (TI +4.2%) are rallying on hopes the ECB will start buying short-term Spanish and Italian government bonds. Telefonica's gains come as the carrier launches Amérigo, a €300M ($378M) VC that will initially focus on Spain, Columbia, Chile, and Brazil, but could eventually expand to other regions.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • SVU

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU -5.5%) slump with the grocery operator's labor turmoils now starting to...

    Shares of Supervalu (SVU -5.5%) slump with the grocery operator's labor turmoils now starting to take center stage. A plan to sell off the company in pieces may look great on paper, but the 42% of Supervalu's workers who are in the middle of a collective bargaining process for new contracts muddy the water a bit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • VSH

    Analog chipmaker Vishay (VSH +3.7%) jumps after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy and sets a $13 PT....

    Analog chipmaker Vishay (VSH +3.7%) jumps after Stifel upgrades shares to Buy and sets a $13 PT. Meanwhile, Israeli foundry Tower Semiconductor (TSEM +10.1%) is shooting higher after announcing it has expanded an outsourcing deal with Vishay to cover additional Vishay chip families.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX +38%) hovers just below the $44 takeout price offered from Valeant...

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX +38%) hovers just below the $44 takeout price offered from Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +14.8%), suggesting that investors aren't expecting any better offers to emerge. Canaccord plays down likelihood of higher bids from other competitors, primarily because the fit is a good one for both companies and supported by both boards. RBC agrees, saying it's a good strategic fit that will likely add 10% to VRX's bottom line.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • DHCP

    Mortgage servicing company Walter Investment Management (WAC +8.2%) continues a torrid run after...

    Mortgage servicing company Walter Investment Management (WAC +8.2%) continues a torrid run after agreeing to purchase Reverse Mortgage Solutions for $120M. About 20% of the purchase will be paid for with Walter's loftily-priced stock, and management expects the deal to be "significantly accretive" to both earnings and cash flow. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI +3.8%) is initiated with a Buy rating at three sellside firms. Goldman...

    Northern Tier Energy (NTI +3.8%) is initiated with a Buy rating at three sellside firms. Goldman calls NTI a "first-of-its-kind" variable distribution refiner MLP, likes NTI's leverage to its Bakken crude oil discounts via the St. Paul Park refining and logistics system, and views favorably its commitment to return available cash to unit holders.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • AMD

    Evercore's Patrick Wang makes a bearish call on PC chip stocks: AMD (AMD -1.9%) and Nvidia (NVDA...

    Evercore's Patrick Wang makes a bearish call on PC chip stocks: AMD (AMD -1.9%) and Nvidia (NVDA -3.9%) have been downgraded to Underweight, and estimates have been cut for Intel (INTC -1.7%). Wang expects AMD to continue underperforming due to high CPU inventories, margin pressure, and tough competition from Intel and ARM-based solutions. As for Nvidia, he thinks Tegra sales could disappoint, partly due to the iPad Mini's arrival and slowing smartphone design wins. (Intel estimate cuts: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    An offshore production and storage vessel being built for Petrobras (PBR -2.1%) in Singapore was...

    An offshore production and storage vessel being built for Petrobras (PBR -2.1%) in Singapore was damaged by fire during testing last week, possibly delaying development of the Bauna and Piracaba fields. A series of delays in building new drilling rigs and production platforms, plus several maintenance shutdowns at offshore platforms, have undercut PBR's crude oil production all year long.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 1 Comment

  • Gold gets jarred above the $1,700/oz. level for the first time since March as the weak ISM print...

    Gold gets jarred above the $1,700/oz. level for the first time since March as the weak ISM print naturally raises the odds of further pump-priming by the Fed. Silver posts an even sharper move, rising to $32.25, its highest price since April.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • YGE

    Solar stocks are off sharply in early trading (TAN -3.7%). Concerns about Europe and China could...

    Solar stocks are off sharply in early trading (TAN -3.7%). Concerns about Europe and China could be weighing, or it could just be that the Street continues to grow more pessimistic following last week's earnings reports (I, II). YGE -9.5%. SPWR -7.8%. LDK -7.6%. FSLR -6.4%. JASO -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    Shares of GameStop (GME +4.8%) get a lift from a strong upgrade by Goldman Sachs to Buy from...

    Shares of GameStop (GME +4.8%) get a lift from a strong upgrade by Goldman Sachs to Buy from Hold. The firm sees secular concerns already factored into GME's share price and calls EPS valuations too low with new console launches and share buybacks on tap.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • F

    Ford (F +1.1%) trades higher after sales of light vehicles shoot up 12.6% in August, compared to...

    Ford (F +1.1%) trades higher after sales of light vehicles shoot up 12.6% in August, compared to the estimate of analysts calling for a 9.8% gain. The automaker saw broad gains in its lineup of cars, utilities, and trucks - helping to justify its plan to increase Q4 production by 7% Y/Y to 725K.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • AAL

    Airline stocks open weak with a new report from an industry group highlighting that profit...

    Netflix (NFLX -9.2%) gets crushed on news of Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) deal with Epix. Since the expiration of the Starz deal, Epix has been Netflix's top source for popular movies. And while the loss of Epix exclusivity was expected, the fact Netflix's top rival now has access to Epix's library is stoking fears the company won't be able to stand out. At $79/year (bundled with Prime shipping), Amazon's Prime Instant Video is cheaper than Netflix on an annual basis, but doesn't offer a monthly option.

    StemCells (STEM) surges 18% premarket after yesterday saying its HuCNS-SC treatment restored sensation in two out of three patients who were left paralyzed by severe spinal cord injuries.
